sentences.english: Like humans, ants can try to outwit foes with cheats and lies.
sentences.chinese: 如人类一样，蚂蚁同样会用假象和欺骗来智取敌人。

sentences.english: He deign'd not to belie his soul in songs.
sentences.chinese: 他未屈尊吟唱，示灵魂以假象。

sentences.english: There are days every now and again I pretend I'm ok but that's not what gets me.
sentences.chinese: 时而有些日子，我装做一切如初，但那只是假象。

sentences.english: She bluffed me into believing that she was an actress.
sentences.chinese: 她以假象骗我相信她是个女演员。

sentences.english: All that investment created the illusion of economic vitality.
sentences.chinese: 所有的投资制造了经济活力的假象。

sentences.english: Yet, this simplicity can be deceptive.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这种简洁是一种假象。

sentences.english: False bottoms and bear market rallies have trapped investors since time immemorial .
sentences.chinese: 投资者落入谷底假象和熊市止跌回升的陷阱久已有之。

sentences.english: Because really, how long can any person fake it and maintain a facade?
sentences.chinese: 因为，确实地，一个人能捏造并保持一个假象多久呢？

sentences.english: But despite some similarities, looks can be deceiving.
sentences.chinese: 尽管确实有些相似之处，但眼见的也可能是假象。

sentences.english: But that is based on an illusion.
sentences.chinese: 但那都是建立在假象上的。

sentences.english: This comb is made from celluloid.
sentences.chinese: 这把梳子是假象牙做的。

sentences.english: Familiarity with artifacts is essential to avoid misdiagnoses.
sentences.chinese: 熟悉各种假象对避免误判是十分必要的。

sentences.english: In particular, when the accessory spleen is located in the pancreas, it may mimic a well-enhancing solid pancreatic tumor.
sentences.chinese: 特别是副脾位于胰腺内，造成胰腺内实性肿瘤的假象。

sentences.english: If there has never been this crisis of death, sanctification is nothing more than a vision.
sentences.chinese: 如果从来没有死亡的转折点，成圣只是一重假象。

sentences.english: She has killed Jamey and planted evidence to suggest it was a suicide.
sentences.chinese: 是她杀了杰米而且安置了证物，弄成自杀的假象。

sentences.english: The wood is perfectly clean, delicate jade, known as celluloid.
sentences.chinese: 其木质洁白无瑕，细腻如玉，被誉为假象牙。

definition: to lure into/to entrap/to trick into/to entice/to induce/to invite/to tempt
to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies
to coerce (sb into doing sth bad)/to lure (into a trap)/to seduce
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
